info.title: Foundations Interactive API Explorer
info.description:
Technical documentation for the Reapit Foundations REST API endpoints. This tool is interactive and provides instant access to data hosted in our sandbox environment with authentication and versioning headers pre-populated. Example requests and responses are shown by default but you can switch to view a fully documented schema - look for the model link.

* To begin developing with the platform, consult our documentation 
* To report a bug or request a new feature, see our help pages 
* For information on terminology, see our glossary 
* Our APIs are located at https://platform.reapit.cloud
* The current API version is 2020-01-31

get.summary: Gets a collection of applicants matching the filter criteria provided

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: A limit on the number of applicants to be returned per page. Value can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 25

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to return (must be greater than 0)

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort results by the value specified. Prefix string with '-' to indicate descending direction (created/modified/nextCall/lastCall)

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: Embed additional resources into the applicants returned

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `id` field matches one or more values provided

parameters.name: age
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `age` field contains one or more values provided

parameters.name: contactDetail
parameters.description: Only return applicants where at least one of the applicants contact details matches one or more values provided

parameters.name: emailAddresses
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `email` field matches one or more values provided

parameters.name: furnishing
parameters.description: Only return appliants where the `furnishing` field contains one or more values provided. Only applicable when marketingMode is renting

parameters.name: locality
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `locality` field contains one or more values provided

parameters.name: negotiatorId
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `negotiatorId` field matches one or more values provided

parameters.name: officeId
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `officeId` field matches one or more values provided

parameters.name: parking
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `parking` field contains one or more values provided

parameters.name: situation
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `situation` field contains one or more values provided

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `style` field contains one or more values provided

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `type` field contains one or more values provided

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `market` field contains one or more values provided

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `address` field matches the value provided

parameters.name: departmentId
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `departmentId` field matches the value provided

parameters.name: marketingMode
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `marketingMode` field matches the value provided

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `name` field matches the value provided

parameters.name: priceFrom
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `buying.priceFrom` field is more than or equal to the value provided

parameters.name: priceTo
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `buying.priceTo` field is less than or equal to the value provided

parameters.name: rentFrom
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `renting.rentFrom` field is more than or equal to the value provided

parameters.name: rentTo
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `renting.rentTo` field is less than or equal to the value provided

parameters.name: rentFrequency
parameters.description: The rent collection frequency that 'rentFrom' and 'rentTo' parameters are in relation to. Defaults to monthly.

parameters.name: bedroomsFrom
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `bedrooms` field is more than or equal to the value provided

parameters.name: bedroomsTo
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `bedrooms` field is less than or equal to the value provided

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `active` field matches the value provided

parameters.name: fromArchive
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `fromArchive` field matches the value provided

parameters.name: createdFrom
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `created` field is on or after the ISO8601 date and time value provided

parameters.name: createdTo
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `created` field is on or before the ISO8601 date and time value provided

parameters.name: modifiedFrom
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `modified` field is on or after the ISO8601 date and time value provided

parameters.name: modifiedTo
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `modified` field is on or before the ISO8601 date and time value provided

parameters.name: lastCallFrom
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `lastCall` field is on or after the ISO8601 date and time value provided

parameters.name: lastCallTo
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `lastCall` field is on or before the ISO8601 date and time value provided

parameters.name: nextCallFrom
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `nextCall` field is on or after the ISO8601 date and time value provided

parameters.name: nextCallTo
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the `nextCall` field is on or before the ISO8601 date and time value provided

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Only return applicants where the metadata matches the filters given

id.description: The unique identifier of the applicant

created.description: The date and time when the applicant was created

modified.description: The date and time when the applicant was last modified

marketingMode.description: Indicates whether the applicant is look to buy or rent a property (buying/renting)

currency.description: The ISO-4217 currency code that relates to monetary amounts specified by the applicant

active.description: A flag determining whether or not the applicant is actively looking for a property

notes.description: A free text field describing any adhoc buying or renting requirements

statusId.description: The status id of the applicant

lastCall.description: The date when the applicant was last contacted

nextCall.description: The date when the applicant is next due to be contacted

departmentId.description: The unique identifier of the department the applicant is associated with. The applicant will only match to properties with the same values set. See the [Platform Glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information about departments

solicitorId.description: The unique identifier of the solicitor associated to the applicant

type.description: The applicant's property type requirements (eg house, bungalow, land), as defined by the applicant's [department](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department)

style.description: The applicant's property style requirements (eg detached, semiDetached), as defined by the applicant's [department](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department)

situation.description: The applicant's requirements for other aspects of prospective properties - such as outside space - as defined by the applicant's [department](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department)

parking.description: The applicant's parking requirements (eg garage), as defined by the applicant's [department](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department)

age.description: The applicant's property age requirements (eg new, period), as defined by the applicant's [department](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department)

locality.description: The applicant's general property location requirements (eg rural, townCity), as defined by the applicant's [department](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department)

specialFeatures.description: The applicant's special feature property requirements (eg swimmingPool, tennisCourt), as defined by the applicant's [department](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department)

unmappedRequirements.description: The requirements associated to the applicant which are not currently mapped. These are defined by the applicant's [department](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department)

value.description: The value associated to the unmapped type

bedroomsMin.description: The minimum number of bedrooms the applicant requires. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

bedroomsMax.description: The maximum number of bedrooms the applicant requires. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

receptionsMin.description: The minimum number of reception rooms the applicant requires. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

receptionsMax.description: The maximum number of reception rooms the applicant requires. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

bathroomsMin.description: The minimum number of bathrooms the applicant requires. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

bathroomsMax.description: The maximum number of bathrooms the applicant requires. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

parkingSpacesMin.description: The minimum number of parking spaces the applicant requires. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

parkingSpacesMax.description: The maximum number of parking spaces the applicant requires. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

archivedOn.description: The date and time the applicant was archived

fromArchive.description: A flag denoting whether or not this applicant is archived

buying.description: The details specific to applicants with a marketingMode of buying

priceFrom.description: The lower bound of the applicant's budget

priceTo.description: The upper bound of the applicant's budget

decoration.description: A list of property decoration requirements taken from the full listing of the associated department (unmodernised/fair/good/veryGood)

reasonId.description: The identifier of the applicant's buying reason

positionId.description: The identifier of the applicant's selling position

renting.description: The details specific to applicants with a marketingMode of renting

moveDate.description: The date the applicant is looking to move to a new property

rentFrom.description: The lower bound of the applicant's budget

rentTo.description: The upper bound of the applicant's budget

rentFrequency.description: The desired rent collection frequency specified by the applicant's budget (weekly/monthly/annually)

furnishing.description: A list of property furnishing requirements taken from the full listing of the associated department. Only applicable to applicants with a marketingMode of renting

positionId.description: The identifier of the applicant's renting position

type.description: The unit of area that each amount corresponds to (acres/hectares)

amountFrom.description: The minimum unit value of outside space that the applicant is looking for

amountTo.description: The maximum unit value of outside space that the applicant is looking for

type.description: The unit of area that each amount corresponds to (squareFeet/squareMetres)

amount.description: The unit value of inside space that the applicant is looking for

id.description: The unique identifier of the applicant's source

useClass.description: The commercial use requirements (eg a1, a2, b1), as defined by the applicant's [department](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department)

floorLevel.description: The commercial floor level attributes (eg basement, subGround, ground, upperFloor), as defined by the property's [department](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department)

regional.description: Details relating to the real estate market in specific countries. Child models are named based on the ISO3166 country code that the data inside the model relates to

ggy.description: Details of regional information specific to Guernsey

market.description: Requirements describing which markets the applicant is looking for properties in (local/openA/openB/openC/openD)

officeIds.description: A collection of unique identifiers of offices attached to the applicant. The first item in the collection is considered the primary office

negotiatorIds.description: A collection of unique identifiers of negotiators attached to the applicant. The first item in the collection is considered the primary negotiator

related.description: A collection of contacts and/or companies associated to the applicant. The first item in the collection is considered the primary relationship

items.description: A summarised view of the details of a contact or company associated to an applicant

id.description: The unique identifier of the contact or company

name.description: The complete name of the contact or company

title.description: The title of the contact (Available when 'type' is 'contact')

forename.description: The forename of the contact (Available when 'type' is 'contact')

surname.description: The surname of the contact (Available when 'type' is 'contact')

dateOfBirth.description: The date of birth of the contact (Available when 'type' is 'contact')

homePhone.description: The home phone number of the contact or company

workPhone.description: The work phone number of the contact or company

mobilePhone.description: The mobile phone number of the contact or company

email.description: The email address of the contact or company

fromArchive.description: A flag denoting whether or not this relationship is archived

primaryAddress.description: Representation of the physical address of a building or premise

line1.description: The first line of the address

line2.description: The second line of the address

line3.description: The third line of the address

line4.description: The fourth line of the address

countryId.description: The ISO-3166 country code that the address resides within

metadata.description: App specific metadata that has been set against the applicant

_eTag.description: The ETag for the current version of the applicant. Used for managing update concurrency

get.summary: Retrieve a collection of contacts

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: A limit on the number of contacts to be returned per page. Value can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 25

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to return (must be greater than 0)

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort results by the value specified. Prefix string with '-' to indicate descending direction (created/modified/name/address)

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: Embed additional resources into the contacts returned

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Only return contacts where the `id` field matches one or more values provided

parameters.name: contactDetail
parameters.description: Only return contacts where at least one of the contact details matches one or more values provided

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Only return contacts where the `email` field matches one or more values provided

parameters.name: negotiatorId
parameters.description: Only return contacts where the `negotiatorId` field matches one or more values provided

parameters.name: officeId
parameters.description: Only return contacts where the `officeId` field matches one or more values provided

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Only return contacts where the `primaryAddress` field matches the value provided

parameters.name: identityCheck
parameters.description: Only return contacts where the `identityCheck` field matches the value provided

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Only return contacts where the `title`, `forename` and/or `surname` field matches the value provided

parameters.name: marketingConsent
parameters.description: Only return contacts where the `marketingConsent` field matches the value provided

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Only return contacts where the `active` field matches the value provided

parameters.name: fromArchive
parameters.description: Only return contacts where the `fromArchive` field matches the value given

parameters.name: createdFrom

items.description: Representation of an offers sales progression information

id.description: The unique identifier of the offer

created.description: The date and time when the offer was created

modified.description: The date and time when the offer was modified

isExternal.description: Flag set to true if this offer is external

propertyId.description: The unique identifier of the property that this offer is associated to. Empty if the offer is external and relates to a property not instructed to the agent

propertyAddress.description: The address of the property that this offer is associated to

vendor.description: The full name of the vendor of the property

vendorId.description: The unique identifier of the vendor that this offer is associated to. Empty if the offer is external and relates to a property not instructed to the agent

vendorSolicitorId.description: The unique identifier of the solicitor / conveyancer that the vendor has instructed

buyer.description: The full name of the buyer who has submitted the offer

buyerId.description: The unique identifier of the contact that represents this buyer. Empty if the offer is external and relates to a property not instructed to the agent

buyerSolicitorId.description: The unique identifier of the solicitor / conveyancer that the buyer has instructed

externalAgent.description: The name of the agent who is marketing the property, where the offer is external and and relates to a property not instructed to the agent

externalAgentId.description: The unique identifier of the agent company that holds the property instruction

upwardChainId.description: The unique identifier of the offer that sits above this one in the chain (where known)

downwardChainId.description: The unique identifier of the offer that sits below this one in the chain (where known)

fixturesAndFittingsCompleted.description: The date when the fixtures and fittings form has been completed

deedsRequested.description: The date when the title deeds were requested from land registry

deedsReceived.description: The date when the title deeds were received from land registry

enquiriesSent.description: The date when the legal enquiries raised by the buyers solicitor were sent

enquiriesAnswered.description: The date when the legal enquiries raised by the buyers solicitor were answered

searchesPaid.description: The date when the buyer paid for conveyancing searches

searchesApplied.description: The date when conveyancing searches were applied for

searchesReceived.description: The date when conveyancing searches were received for

contractSent.description: The date when the draft contract was sent

contractReceived.description: The date when the draft contract was received

contractApproved.description: The date when the contract was approved

contractVendorSigned.description: The date when the vendor signed the approved contract

contractBuyerSigned.description: The date when the buyer signed the approved contract

mortgageRequired.description: Indication of whether the buyer will require a mortgage to fund the purchase (yes/no/unknown)

mortgageLoanPercentage.description: The loan to value percentage of the mortgage required

mortgageSubmitted.description: The date when the mortgage application was submitted

mortgageOfferReceived.description: The date when the mortgage offer was received

mortgageLenderId.description: The unique identifier of the company who will provide the mortgage

mortgageBrokerId.description: The unique identifier of the company who brokered the mortgage

mortgageSurveyDate.description: The date of the mortgage valuation/survey

mortgageSurveyorId.description: The unique identifier of the company who will perform the mortgage valuation/survey

additionalSurveyRequired.description: Indication of whether the buyer requires that an additional survey take place  (yes/no/unknown)

additionalSurveyDate.description: The date of the additional survey

additionalSurveyorId.description: The unique identifier of the company who will perform the additional survey

exchangedVendor.description: The date when the vendor conveyancer confirms the exchange

exchangedBuyer.description: The date when the buyer conveyancer confirms the exchange

completion.description: The date when the sale completed

id.description: The unique identifier of the enquiry

created.description: The date and time when the enquiry was created

modified.description: The date and time when the enquiry was last modified

title.description: The title of the individual making the enquiry

forename.description: The forename of the individual making the enquiry

surname.description: The surname of the individual making the enquiry

enquiryType.description: The type of enquiry. Enquiries can created for applicants interested in buying/renting, as well as prospective vendors and landlords (salesApplicant/lettingsApplicant/salesProperty/lettingsProperty)

message.description: Textual information about the nature of the enquiry - usually the message text from the individual making the enquiry

officeId.description: The unique identifier of the office related to the enquiry

sourceName.description: The name of the source that the enquiry was generated by

homePhone.description: The home phone number of the individual making the enquiry

workPhone.description: The work phone number of the individual making the enquiry

mobilePhone.description: The mobile phone number of the individual making the enquiry

email.description: The email of the individual making the enquiry

address.description: Representation of the physical address of a building or premise

line1.description: The first line of the address

line2.description: The second line of the address

line3.description: The third line of the address

line4.description: The fourth line of the address

countryId.description: The ISO-3166 country code that the address resides within

buying.description: Request body used to create a buying enquiry

priceFrom.description: The lower bound of the prospective buyer's budget

priceTo.description: The upper bound of the prospective buyer's budget

renting.description: The details specific to enquiries with a type of lettingsApplicant

rentFrom.description: The lower bound of the prospective tenant's budget

rentTo.description: The upper bound of the prospective tenant's budget

rentFrequency.description: How often the tenant would like to pay the rent (weekly/monthly/annually)

bedrooms.description: The number of bedrooms the prospective buyer or tenant requires

propertyIds.description: A list of unique property identifiers that this enquiry relates to. Used to indicate the properties that a sales or lettings applicant has expressed an interest in

items.description:
Representation of a property. Properties can be grouped into developments in the source data, functionality that is typically used by New Homes departments.
The _links collection will expose specific links to allow developers to navigate through a particular development, should a property be configured in this manner. Refer to commentary on the _links collection for more details

id.description: The unique identifier of the property

created.description: The date and time when the property was created

modified.description: The date and time when the property was last modified

marketingMode.description: The marketing mode of the property (selling/letting/sellingAndLetting)

currency.description: The currency that applies to monetary amounts exposed in the model

alternateId.description: An optional alternative identifier specified for this property

address.description: Representation of the physical address of a building or premise

line1.description: The first line of the address

line2.description: The second line of the address

line3.description: The third line of the address

line4.description: The fourth line of the address

countryId.description: The ISO-3166 country code that the address resides within

geolocation.description: Representation of the geographical location of an address using coordinates

latitude.description: The latitude coordinate of the coordinate pair

longitude.description: The longitude coordinate of the coordinate pair

areaId.description: The unique identifier of the area that the property resides in

strapline.description: The strapline description containing a short summary about the property

description.description: The brief description of the property

longDescription.description: The long description of the property

summary.description: The summary of accommodation, typically short phrases or bullet points describing the key features of the property

departmentId.description: The unique identifier of the department the property is associated with. The property will only match to applicants with the same values set. See the [Platform Glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information about departments

negotiatorId.description: The unique identifier of the negotiator managing the property

bedrooms.description: The total number of bedrooms in the property. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

bedroomsMax.description: The maximum number of bedrooms in the property or properties. This is typically used when marketing development sites and would be set on the master record. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

receptions.description: The total number of reception rooms in the property. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

bathrooms.description: The total number of bathrooms in the property. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

numberOfUnits.description: The number of units offered on the market. This is typically used when marketing development sites.

parkingSpaces.description: The total number of parking spaces the property has. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

councilTax.description: The council tax banding of the property (A/B/C/D/E/F/G/H/I/notYetAvailable)

disabledPortalIds.description: A collection of identifiers of portals that the property should not be displayed on

internetAdvertising.description: A flag denoting whether or not this property can be advertised on the internet

isExternal.description: A flag denoting whether or not the property has been instructed by another estate agent

viewingArrangements.description: The arrangements regarding viewing the property

videoUrl.description: The url of a video associated with this property, such as a virtual tour

videoCaption.description: The caption for the video url associated with this property

video2Url.description: The url of a second video associated with this property, such as a virtual tour

video2Caption.description: The caption for the second video url associated with this property

notes.description: Any general notes regarding the property. These are not usually exposed to end users and may contain sensitive information about a sale

boardStatus.description: The status of the advertising board sited outside or near to the property

boardNotes.description: Any notes relevant to the advertising board sited outside or near to the property

url.description: The url to the property on an external website

groundRent.description: Any ground rent payment that applies to the property

groundRentComment.description: Comments regarding the ground rent of the property

groundRentReviewDate.description: The date when the ground rent payable on the property should be reviewed

groundRentIncrease.description: The annual percentage increase of the ground rent after being reviewed

serviceCharge.description: Any service charge payment that applies to the property

serviceChargeComment.description: Comments regarding the service charge of the property

boardUpdated.description: The date the advertising board was last updated (or should be updated when the date is in the future)

archivedOn.description: The date and time the property was archived

fromArchive.description: A flag determining whether or not the property is archived

tenureId.description: Details of the rural tenure associated with the property.

buildingsDescription.description: Details of the buildings associated with the property.

landDescription.description: Details of the land associated with the property.

externalArea.description: Representation of the external land area of a property

internalArea.description: Representation of the internal dimensions of a property

exempt.description: A flag denoting whether or not this property is exempt from requiring an EPC certificate

selling.description: Representation of property details specific to sales marketing

_links.description:
Collection containing relative URLs to data associated with the property.
In the case of a development - where a property is grouped with, or associated to another property by way of a parent/child relationship,
the collection will contain a _master_ or _subPlot_ link depending on the property type. Where the property is the master record in a development (the parent),
a _subPlots_ link will be included in the collection giving you access to all the plots (the children) within the development. Where the property is a sub plot that forms part of a 
development, a _master_ link will be included in the collection giving you access to the master record.

_embedded.description: We are delighted to offer for sale this EXTENDED THREE BEDROOMED SEMI DETACHED PROPERTY situated in a much sought after residential location of Greasby, having the benefits of two separate entertaining rooms, morning room, extended kitchen. To the first floor there are three bedrooms, spacious family bathroom, gas central heating gardens front and rear and off road parking.
_embedded.longDescription: The ground floor accommodation comprises of a spacious reception hall with a wet bar, a grand drawing room, master bedroom suite and a further bedroom suite. The lower floor comprises of an eat in kitchen leading to converted vaults which could be used as staff accommodation or a study. There is also separate dining room and a further bedroom suite.
_embedded.notes: Property was on the market previously with another agent but struggled to get much interest

Representation of a property. Properties can be grouped into developments in the source data, functionality that is typically used by New Homes departments.
The _links collection will expose specific links to allow developers to navigate through a particular development, should a property be configured in this manner. Refer to commentary on the _links collection for more details

lostInstructionNote.description: The notes regarding the lost instruction

metadata.description: App specific metadata that has been set against the property

_eTag.description: The ETag for the current version of the property. Used for managing update concurrency

_links.description:
Collection containing relative URLs to data associated with the property.
In the case of a development - where a property is grouped with, or associated to another property by way of a parent/child relationship,
the collection will contain a _master_ or _subPlot_ link depending on the property type. Where the property is the master record in a development (the parent),
a _subPlots_ link will be included in the collection giving you access to all the plots (the children) within the development. Where the property is a sub plot that forms part of a 
development, a _master_ link will be included in the collection giving you access to the master record.

application/json.description: We are delighted to offer for sale this EXTENDED THREE BEDROOMED SEMI DETACHED PROPERTY situated in a much sought after residential location of Greasby, having the benefits of two separate entertaining rooms, morning room, extended kitchen. To the first floor there are three bedrooms, spacious family bathroom, gas central heating gardens front and rear and off road parking.
application/json.longDescription: The ground floor accommodation comprises of a spacious reception hall with a wet bar, a grand drawing room, master bedroom suite and a further bedroom suite. The lower floor comprises of an eat in kitchen leading to converted vaults which could be used as staff accommodation or a study. There is also separate dining room and a further bedroom suite.
application/json.notes: Property was on the market previously with another agent but struggled to get much interest

rooms.name: Dining Room
rooms.description: The formal dining room is the perfect space to entertain and provides access to the useful study.

type.description: The applicant's property type requirements (eg house, bungalow, land), as defined by the applicant's [department](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department)

style.description: The applicant's property style requirements (eg detached, semiDetached), as defined by the applicant's [department](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department)

ConveyancingModel.description: Representation of an offers sales progression information

id.description: The unique identifier of the offer

created.description: The date and time when the offer was created

modified.description: The date and time when the offer was modified

isExternal.description: Flag set to true if this offer is external

propertyId.description: The unique identifier of the property that this offer is associated to. Empty if the offer is external and relates to a property not instructed to the agent

propertyAddress.description: The address of the property that this offer is associated to

vendor.description: The full name of the vendor of the property

vendorId.description: The unique identifier of the vendor that this offer is associated to. Empty if the offer is external and relates to a property not instructed to the agent

vendorSolicitorId.description: The unique identifier of the solicitor / conveyancer that the vendor has instructed

buyer.description: The full name of the buyer who has submitted the offer

buyerId.description: The unique identifier of the contact that represents this buyer. Empty if the offer is external and relates to a property not instructed to the agent

buyerSolicitorId.description: The unique identifier of the solicitor / conveyancer that the buyer has instructed

externalAgent.description: The name of the agent who is marketing the property, where the offer is external and and relates to a property not instructed to the agent

externalAgentId.description: The unique identifier of the agent company that holds the property instruction

upwardChainId.description: The unique identifier of the offer that sits above this one in the chain (where known)

downwardChainId.description: The unique identifier of the offer that sits below this one in the chain (where known)

fixturesAndFittingsCompleted.description: The date when the fixtures and fittings form has been completed

deedsRequested.description: The date when the title deeds were requested from land registry

deedsReceived.description: The date when the title deeds were received from land registry

enquiriesSent.description: The date when the legal enquiries raised by the buyers solicitor were sent

enquiriesAnswered.description: The date when the legal enquiries raised by the buyers solicitor were answered

searchesPaid.description: The date when the buyer paid for conveyancing searches

searchesApplied.description: The date when conveyancing searches were applied for

searchesReceived.description: The date when conveyancing searches were received for

contractSent.description: The date when the draft contract was sent

contractReceived.description: The date when the draft contract was received

contractApproved.description: The date when the contract was approved

contractVendorSigned.description: The date when the vendor signed the approved contract

contractBuyerSigned.description: The date when the buyer signed the approved contract

mortgageRequired.description: Indication of whether the buyer will require a mortgage to fund the purchase (yes/no/unknown)

mortgageLoanPercentage.description: The loan to value percentage of the mortgage required

mortgageSubmitted.description: The date when the mortgage application was submitted

mortgageOfferReceived.description: The date when the mortgage offer was received

mortgageLenderId.description: The unique identifier of the company who will provide the mortgage

mortgageBrokerId.description: The unique identifier of the company who brokered the mortgage

mortgageSurveyDate.description: The date of the mortgage valuation/survey

mortgageSurveyorId.description: The unique identifier of the company who will perform the mortgage valuation/survey

additionalSurveyRequired.description: Indication of whether the buyer requires that an additional survey take place  (yes/no/unknown)

additionalSurveyDate.description: The date of the additional survey

additionalSurveyorId.description: The unique identifier of the company who will perform the additional survey

exchangedVendor.description: The date when the vendor conveyancer confirms the exchange

exchangedBuyer.description: The date when the buyer conveyancer confirms the exchange

completion.description: The date when the sale completed

_eTag.description: The ETag for the current version of this conveyancing record. Used for managing update concurrency

metadata.description: App specific metadata that has been set against this conveyancing record

agent.description: The name of the agent managing the sale of the property. (Required when 'offerId' is not provided)

vendor.description: The name of the vendor selling the property. (Required when 'offerId' is not provided)

vendorSolicitorId.description: The unique identifier of the solicitor / conveyancer that the vendor has instructed. (Required when 'offerId' is not provided)

CreateIdentityDocumentModel.description:
Request body to attach an identity document to a new contact identity check
A second identity document is not required and can be ignored by being set to null

typeId.description: The unique identifier of the type of identity document provided

expiry.description: The date when the document expires and becomes invalid

details.description: Details regarding the identity document (eg. passport number) (Required when 'fileData' is not given)

fileData.description:
The base64 encoded identity document content, prefixed with the content type (eg. data:text/plain;base64,VGVzdCBmaWxl) (Required when 'details' are not given)
The total request payload cannot exceed 6Mb, regardless of the number of documents being sent

fileUrl.description: The presigned s3 url which a document has been uploaded to (This supports files up to 30MB)

name.description: The filename to store the document as (Required when 'details' are not given)

CreateMetadataRequest.description: Payload to create a metadata record

entityType.description:
The type of the entity that this metadata is related to. This can represent a Foundations inbuilt type (an entity presented in our APIs) or it can be a custom entity type (a dynamic standalone metadata entity that you create).
            
Inbuilt types: applicant, appointment, company, contact, conveyancing, identityCheck, landlord, negotiator, offer, office, property, task, vendor, worksOrder

entityId.description:
The unique identifier of the entity that this metadata is related to.
For custom entities, this can be left blank and an id will be generated for you.

metadata.description: The JSON document to store

PropertyModel.description:
Representation of a property. Properties can be grouped into developments in the source data, functionality that is typically used by New Homes departments.
The _links collection will expose specific links to allow developers to navigate through a particular development, should a property be configured in this manner. Refer to commentary on the _links collection for more details

id.description: The unique identifier of the property

created.description: The date and time when the property was created

modified.description: The date and time when the property was last modified

marketingMode.description: The marketing mode of the property (selling/letting/sellingAndLetting)

currency.description: The currency that applies to monetary amounts exposed in the model

alternateId.description: An optional alternative identifier specified for this property

address.description: Representation of the physical address of a building or premise

line1.description: The first line of the address

line2.description: The second line of the address

line3.description: The third line of the address

line4.description: The fourth line of the address

countryId.description: The ISO-3166 country code that the address resides within

geolocation.description: Representation of the geographical location of an address using coordinates

latitude.description: The latitude coordinate of the coordinate pair

longitude.description: The longitude coordinate of the coordinate pair

areaId.description: The unique identifier of the area that the property resides in

strapline.description: The strapline description containing a short summary about the property

description.description: The brief description of the property

longDescription.description: The long description of the property

summary.description: The summary of accommodation, typically short phrases or bullet points describing the key features of the property

departmentId.description: The unique identifier of the department the property is associated with. The property will only match to applicants with the same values set. See the [Platform Glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information about departments

negotiatorId.description: The unique identifier of the negotiator managing the property

bedrooms.description: The total number of bedrooms in the property. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

bedroomsMax.description: The maximum number of bedrooms in the property or properties. This is typically used when marketing development sites and would be set on the master record. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

receptions.description: The total number of reception rooms in the property. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

bathrooms.description: The total number of bathrooms in the property. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

numberOfUnits.description: The number of units offered on the market. This is typically used when marketing development sites.

parkingSpaces.description: The total number of parking spaces the property has. This is only supported by some departments. Please [refer to the glossary](https://foundations-documentation.reapit.cloud/platform-glossary#department) for more information

councilTax.description: The council tax banding of the property (A/B/C/D/E/F/G/H/I/notYetAvailable)

viewingArrangements.description: The arrangements regarding viewing the property

video2Url.description: The url of a second video associated with this property, such as a virtual tour

notes.description: Any general notes regarding the property. These are not usually exposed to end users and may contain sensitive information about a sale

_links.description:
Collection containing relative URLs to data associated with the property.
In the case of a development - where a property is grouped with, or associated to another property by way of a parent/child relationship,
the collection will contain a _master_ or _subPlot_ link depending on the property type. Where the property is the master record in a development (the parent),
a _subPlots_ link will be included in the collection giving you access to all the plots (the children) within the development. Where the property is a sub plot that forms part of a 
development, a _master_ link will be included in the collection giving you access to the master record.

items.description:
Representation of a property. Properties can be grouped into developments in the source data, functionality that is typically used by New Homes departments.
The _links collection will expose specific links to allow developers to navigate through a particular development, should a property be configured in this manner. Refer to commentary on the _links collection for more details

modified.description: The date and time when the property was last modified

marketingMode.description: The marketing mode of the property (selling/letting/sellingAndLetting)

alternateId.description: An optional alternative identifier specified for this property

bedroomsMax.description: The maximum number of bedrooms in the property or properties. This is typically used when marketing development sites and would be set on the master record. example.description: We are delighted to offer for sale this EXTENDED THREE BEDROOMED SEMI DETACHED PROPERTY situated in a much sought after residential location of Greasby, having the benefits of two separate entertaining rooms, morning room, extended kitchen. To the first floor there are three bedrooms, spacious family bathroom, gas central heating gardens front and rear and off road parking.
example.notes: Property was on the market previously with another agent but struggled to get much interest
example.longDescription: The ground floor accommodation comprises of a spacious reception hall with a wet bar, a grand drawing room, master bedroom suite and a further bedroom suite. The lower floor comprises of an eat in kitchen leading to converted vaults which could be used as staff accommodation or a study. There is also separate dining room and a further bedroom suite.

letting.worksOrderNote: Please arrange access to property directly with the tenant

rooms.name: Kitchen
rooms.description: The breakfast kitchen, with utility, comprises a matching range of wall and base units with ceramic hob and eye level double oven. A side door leads to the front courtyard area.

rooms.name: Lounge
rooms.description: The lounge, with a brick feature fireplace housing a Clearview stove, provides an ideal space to relax and unwind, whilst enjoying views over the Golf Course.

rooms.name: Dining Room
rooms.description: The formal dining room is the perfect space to entertain and provides access to the useful study.
